{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3279471,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-10T12:13:18.266Z","cooked":"

Hi, we are trying to use the 2-meter distance sensor from Rev.
when we are running the code we get an error saying something about the distance sensor drive. I have found the .so file of the driver but I don’t know how to install it.

  1. How do you install .so drivers to your roboRio?

  2. Do you have any experience with it?

Thanks in advance.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-01-10T12:13:18.266Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":312,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":1612.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":449164,"topic_slug":"rev-2m-distance-sensor-with-roborio","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/rev-2m-distance-sensor-with-roborio/449164/1","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3279476,"name":"","username":"Jupiter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jupiter/{size}/180066_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-10T12:27:15.104Z","cooked":"
GalDotan:

How do you install .so drivers to your roboRio?

See here

GitHub

Release Release v2023.0.4 · REVrobotics/2m-Distance-Sensor

Release for 2023 FRC season. Refer to the README for installation instructions. Note: For LabVIEW, you will still need to deploy Java/C++ 2m distance sensor code before being able to use the LabVIE...

I tried everything in the manual.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-01-10T12:39:25.918Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":449164,"topic_slug":"rev-2m-distance-sensor-with-roborio","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/rev-2m-distance-sensor-with-roborio/449164/3","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3279596,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-10T15:06:52.259Z","cooked":"

You don’t use the .so directly. You should install the Rev vendordep json file into your project vendordeps/ folder. This will be picked up by Gradle and ensure the headers and library are connected to the build; the library will then be automatically deployed to the robot as part of the deploy process for the rest of the robot program.

“jsonUrl”:“https://www.revrobotics.com/content/sw/max/sdk/Rev2mDistanceSensor.json”,

Downshifted the version from 0.4.0 to 0.3.0 since WPI still had the dependencies hosted. That fixed the issue and allowed my code to build, but I’m surpised there’s no 0.4.0 files hosted anywhere

Best I can tell 0.3.0 is from 2020, and almost certainly won’t work with 2024 wpilib.

Did you follow the installation instructions? GitHub - REVrobotics/2m-Distance-Sensor: Port of ST vl53l0x driver for roboRIO to operate the REV Robotics 2m Distance Sensor.
